content: ballet wrap cardigan the ballet wrap cardigan is knitted top down with saddle shoulder and raglan technique it is an overlapped design with a cropped style and it is designed to have a tight fit the main pattern is a rib pattern with knit2 purl1 lolbert-szabó júlia ©copyright 2024 instagram @lsz_juli this pattern is for personal non-commercial use only the pattern may not be copied resold or redistributed in any way 1 sizes xs s m l xl xxl finished garment measurements the cardigan has ~5 cm positive ease so you have to calculate with that when you choose the size bust circumference 86 90 94 98 102 106 cm full length 46 47 48 49 50 51 cm length from the underarm 24 24 26 26 28 28 cm sleeve length from underarm 50 cm in all size or desired length used yarn 1 strand of drops flora 200 200 250 300 350 350 g hold together with 1 strand of drops brushed alpaca 150 150 200 250 300 300 g recommendation is to use a similar kind of fingering type of yarn held together with lace type of yarn gauge knitting with the main pattern k2 p1 10x10cm = 23 stitch x 27 row needles 4 mm circular needles for the body 3 5 mm circular needles and double pointed needles for the double band and the tie belt used techniques/abbreviations m1l →make one left m1r →make one right m1pl →make one purl left m1pr → make one purl right k2tog → knit to together ssk → slip slip knit bor → beginning of the round double edge cast on/knitting judy s magic cast on italian bind off lolbert-szabó júlia ©copyright 2024 instagram @lsz_juli this pattern is for personal non-commercial use only the pattern may not be copied resold or redistributed in any way 2 upper back cast on 51 54 54 57 57 60 stitches on 4 mm needles and purl 1 row divide the stitches as follows and place stitch markers between them 1 - 8 - 33 36 36 39 39 42 - 8 - 1 1-1 stitch for the front parts 8-8 stitches for the shoulders rest for the back part the main pattern will be k2 p1 you have to knit that pattern i section you will shape this part with increases on both sides of the 8 shoulder stitches ii section in this part increases are worked for the sleeves only iii section this part is shaped with classic raglan increases now you have to start the increasing as follows 1 section ● rs row 1 ○ k1 ○ m1r sm ○ k8 stockinette stitch sm ○ m1l ○ knit back stitches start with 1k 1p and continue with the k2 p1 pattern end this section with 1k ○ m1r sm ○ k8 with stockinette stitch sm ○ m1l ○ k1 you increased 4 stitches now you have 55 58 58 61 61 64 stitches on your needle ● ws row 2
